citations.narrative:
- At least five cages containing juvenile parakeets had an insufficient amount of perching space relative to the number of
animals contained per cage. Lack of perch space could be a source of stress and discomfort to birds. All birds that perch
are required to have a sufficient number of appropriate perches that can comfortably hold all birds in the enclosure at the
same time. Corrected at time of inspection by adding additional perches.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
n

narrative:
3.153(a)(2) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
- At least five cages containing juvenile parakeets had an insufficient amount of perching space relative to the number of 
animals contained per cage. Lack of perch space could be a source of stress and discomfort to birds. All birds that perch 
are required to have a sufficient number of appropriate perches that can comfortably hold all birds in the enclosure at the 
same time. Corrected at time of inspection by adding additional perches. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee. 
 
 n
